text: Clifton Bertrand (2 March 1936 - 28 November 2020) was a Trinidadian sprinter. He was born in Arima, Trinidad and Tobago. He won three bronze medals at the Pan American Games in 1959 and 1963. Bertrand also competed during the 1960 and 1964 Summer Olympics. Bertrand died on 28 November 2020 in New York City at the age of 84.Olympian Bertrand passes at 84 ==References== Category:1936 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Trinidad and Tobago athletes Category:Olympians for Trinidad and Tobago Category:Sprinters
title: Clifton Bertrand
